revised_title: Aerodynamic Resistance to a Sphere Rotating at High Mach Numbers in the Rarefied Transition Regime
tldr: The authors conducted an experimental study of the gaseous drag torque on an isolated sphere rotating at high Mach numbers. They used electromagnetic suspension and induction to suspend and spin the sphere, and measured the drag torque through the transition regime from continuum to free molecule flow. The results showed an unexpected Mach number dependence in the transition regime, and the authors discussed a simple physical model to explain the drag variation.
